request_pathways.name: Generic Authorization for Release of Medical Records
Privacy Officer, 402 Lippincott Dr, Marlton, NJ 08053

forms.document_type: General consent, disclosure and authorization form (intake)
HIPAA acknowledgment of receipt of privacy practices

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient must locate a generic, unbranded third-party release authorization form hosted on a third-party server, print and handwrite it, then independently determine where to submit it.

red_flags: Form provides no submission instructions — no address, fax, email, or portal link
Form is unbranded with no organizational identity — patient cannot confirm it belongs to their provider
Missing HIPAA-required authorization elements: no expiration date, no revocation language, no disclosing entity name
Record Number field requested without explanation of where patient would find it
bright_spots: Notice of Privacy Practices (form-4) is current (2025) and includes reproductive health care protections per 2024 HIPAA Final Rule
NPP explicitly acknowledges patients' right to electronic access to PHI

findability.rationale: Level 1: Effectively unfindable online — the main Consensus Health website has no forms section, extensive multi-strategy searching produced nothing, and the only ROI form was found on a third-party CDN with no link from any Consensus Health page.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Primarily a paper workflow — zero fillable fields across all forms, patient must print and handwrite, and no electronic submission pathway is documented on the form itself.

content_design.rationale: Level 2: The form is functionally unusable without outside help — it provides no submission instructions, no organizational branding, no contact information, and asks for a 'Record Number' patients won't know.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is an afterthought — the only form found is structured as a third-party release authorization with no accommodation for patients requesting their own records, and no dedicated patient access pathway exists.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: The form lacks HIPAA-required authorization elements (expiration, revocation, disclosing entity) and the NPP fee language is vague, but no overtly illegitimate barriers like notarization or excessive fees are imposed.

overall.summary: Consensus Health lacks any functional online pathway for patients to request their own medical records, offering only an unbranded, non-fillable third-party authorization form with no submission instructions, found only through extensive searching of third-party sites.
